com.nokia.maps.component.ui

Class Renderer

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.nokia.maps.component.ui.Renderer

  • public abstract class Renderer
extends java.lang.Object
    This class offers an abstract base class for rendering UI elements. The Renderer class is responsible for painting a styled box with the a UI element within it.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      protected static int POP_UP_MARGINS
      Default pop-up margin size in pixels.

    • Field Detail

      • POP_UP_MARGINS

        protected static final int POP_UP_MARGINS
        Default pop-up margin size in pixels. The margin always leaves some of the MapCanvas uncovered, allowing the user to continue to see some of the map even if a pop-up is present.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • paint

        public void paint(javax.microedition.lcdui.Graphics g)
        This method paints the associated UI element if one is currently defined.
        Parameters:
        g - the graphics object used for rendering

      • setAnchor

        public final void setAnchor(int x,
             int y)
        This method sets up the background for display
        Parameters:
        x - x axis pixel coordinate of the top left corner anchoring the UI of this component
        y - y axis pixel coordinate of the top left corner anchoring the UI of this component

      • getAnchor

        public final Point getAnchor()
        This method retrieves the location in pixels of the top-left corner of the UI element on screen.
        Returns:
        The top-left corner of this UI element on screen.

      • isHighlight

        public boolean isHighlight()
        This method retrieves a boolean value indicating whether the UI is currently highlighted
        Returns:
        true if the UI is highlighted, false otherwise.

      • setHighlight

        public void setHighlight(boolean highlight)
        This method sets a boolean value indicating whether to highlight the UI or not. Typically highlighting occurs on the touch event.
        Parameters:
        highlight -

      • setBackground

        public final void setBackground(BackgroundBox background)
        This method sets the background of this UI item
        Parameters:
        background - the background of the UI

        public final BackgroundBox getBackground()
        This method retrieves the background of this UI item
